intro: Boechera fendleri, commonly known as desert rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Boechera fendleri is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
